page.title: 18Entertainment
page.content: Of the families interviewed only one did not have a television set and that was for religious reasons. Most televisions were coloured sets and many had a second set which was portable and usually black and white. About one in ten also owned a video recorder and hired videos of popular films to watch at home. About one in eight of families with school children owned a computer that was capable of playing games. The local Community Arts group in Newent runs a programme of films during the winter months. Popular recent films are to be seen at the cinema in Gloucester. The television is by far the greatest source of home entertainment and outside various groups run dances and supper evenings especially during the winter season.
